instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not wake from suspend
threads.message: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> if suspend need to force shut down. Any test I can do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not wake from suspend
threads.message: <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> rework should be done first. Any history? Diagnostics test run?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not wake from suspend
threads.message: ASD or some program that test all like tech tool pro?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not wake from suspend
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not wake from suspend
threads.message: This runs ASD 155, but you should do what Duke said and resolder/reflow <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> that is likely the issue.
